<answer>



It's called She Gets What She Wants.



</answer>



<answer from>



MystMoon...
Member since: 09 September 2007
Total points: 69267 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



Slap Her... She's French (2002)
aka She Gets What She Wants
IMDb synopsis:
A French foreign exchange student named Genevieve (Piper Perabo), comes to a small town in Texas to attend a local high school. Her host family includes Starla (Janet McGregor), the school's popular head cheerleader. But,  Starla soon learns that this French girl is not only smart, attractive, and naive but also quite conniving when Geneviere, with no social life of her own, begins to take over Starla's, starting with stealing the affection of her parents, her friends and Starla's boyfriend (Matt Czuchry). When Starla finally catches on, she begins an all-out personal war against Genevieve to take back her life.

I LOVE this movie! It goes on many of my Y!A suggestion lists. I'm not sure if anyone else finds it as hilarious as I do, but I think it's far better than most of the high school comedies I've seen.



Source(s):



http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0187512/



</answer>

<question>



What is that littlelight in the front of his chest in the movie Iron Man?



Is it something to help keep him alive?



If so, what did these people do to him before he did that?



I watch it three times and still having problems figuring out



</question>



<answer from>



Cub13
Member since: 26 September 2008
Total points: 212 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



its a power source for an electromagnet he has to keep in his chest to live. in an explosion he got shrapnel lodged the area right around his heart. the magnet pulls on the small grenade fragments and keeps them from slipping closer to his heart



</answer>

<question>



What is the name of the film with the sea lion in?



IT ISN'T SLAPPY THE SEAL! There is a film that i watched when i was younger about this girl and she makes friends with this sea lion. Her dad finds it and they keep it in their garage and try to feed it etc and when it's older she teaches it all these tricks and stuff. Eventually they release it back into the wild but it comes back from migration once a year or something like that anyway.
Could someone tell me what the name of the film is??



</question>



<answer from>



Roy D
Member since: 28 February 2008
Total points: 10765 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



Andre



</answer>



<answer from>



MystMoon...
Member since: 09 September 2007
Total points: 71366 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



This is a seal film:
Andre (1994)
IMDb synopsis:
Toni Whitney and her family adopt a baby seal. When it grows and starts getting into mischief, it antagonizes some of the fisherman in the town. One of the fisherman, Mark Baker, is upset with the Whitney's because Toni's father, Harry, was appointed Harbor Master instead of him, partially because of the seal. But when the humorous antics of the seal attracts media attention, further squeezing out Mark, and running down his business, he gets even more upset.



For a sea lion movie, try this one:
Salty (1973)
IMDb synopsis:
After their parents are killed in a hurricane, Taylor and Tim Reed are unofficially adopted by the semi-retired owner of a marina in the Bahamas. The Reed children are also "adopted" by a friendly sea lion whom they name Salty and with whom they have a series of adventures.



Hmmmm... What is the difference between a seal and a sea lion? I have to check on that. Courtesy of Wikipedia: "Some species of sea lions are readily trainable and are often a popular attraction at zoos and aquariums. The archetypal circus seal performing behaviors such as throwing and catching balls on its nose and clapping is almost always a sea lion."



Source(s):



http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0109120/
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0271767/plot...
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_lion



</answer>

Venus 1485AD

<original file>11888.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk61422.txt</current file name>




<category>



Entertainment & Music



Movies



</category>



<question from>



Amber
Member since: 29 September 2008
Total points: 94 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What makes David Fincher's films so dark and edgy?



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



He takes on very dark scripts. He doesnt write any of them, but his directing style was developed from scripts like fight club, seven, and zodiac. Those are all very dark scripts so he has become accustomed to that sort of directing style. Also, his new movie Benjamin Button looks very dark but he looks as though he is evolving and the movie appears to look like a Tim Burton film.



</answer>

<category>

</category>



<question from>



decksper...
Member since: 16 September 2008
Total points: 106 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Can u  tell me pls the title of dat movie where the old woman starts to plant grass to pay the debits. Cornwal?



the actress is originally from Cornwall



</question>



<answer from>



Marilyn B
Member since: 09 October 2006
Total points: 45262 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Saving Grace (2000)--Unexpectedly widowed, prim and proper housewife Grace Trevethyn finds herself in dire financial straits when she inherits massive debts her late husband had been accruing for years. Faced with losing her house, she decides to use her talent for horticulture and hatches a plan to grow potent marijuana which can be sold at an astronomical price, thus solving her financial crisis. Grace and her gardener's efforts to hide their illegal enterprise from the quaint and curious townsfolk and market their product provide some fun. It stars Brenda Blethyn as Grace Trevethyn. Blethyn is originally from Ramsgate, Kent, England.



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brenda_Blet...



</answer>

<question>



Question & comments about the film "We are Marshall"?



First of all, let me just say that this movie was almost as depressing as "The Notebook" for me. This was a true story that took place right around the time I was born (1970) so I'm too young to recall this tragedy for real.



Questions:
1) What did you think of this movie?
2) Are you old enough to remember this tragedy as it unfolded?
3) Are you connected with West Virginia in any way?



Thanks.......and I look forward to your answers/comments.



-Primo



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



1. I didn't like the movie very much. It had annoying acting, choppy football scenes, and too melodramatic. They shoud've tried to make it less of a cliche inspirational football movie, and make it into a heartfelt drama. Personally I think the families of the victims deserved a better tribute.
2. I'm 17 so I'm not really familiar with the tragedy.
3. No



</answer>

<answer from>



LiveandL...
Member since: 22 June 2006
Total points: 916 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Who cares... they all sucked.
When I looked it up, it said "The Mask 2: Son of the Mask"
But, I also found this:
WHEN THE Jim Carrey comedy The Mask became a blockbuster last year, New Line Cinema giddily made plans for a sequel. But don't hold your breath for the tentatively titled Revenge of the Mask. Last week, Hollywood's $20 million man began shooting the black comedy Cable Guy with Matthew Broderick. He'll then jump into Universal's Liar, Liar; and after that, he'll take on a more serious role in Peter Weir's The Truman Show. New Line now says Revenge won't reach screens until Christmas 1997. ''It's a priority for [Carrey], and for us,'' insists a spokesman for New Line, which took out a trade ad in 1994 saying it would exercise its option for Carrey to redon the mask. But Carrey's manager Jimmy Miller has a different take: ''Right now, we're waiting for the script. Jim's contract on The Mask had no option for a sequel, so it will be a brand-new deal.''



Source(s):



http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,299919,0...

<question from>



ARLLYN P
Member since: 24 April 2008
Total points: 1311 (Level 3)



</question from>



<question>



Why, in the movie 21, is ben called the 'donkey' boy?



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



It was the job of the team member dubbed the "Donkey Boy" to inconspicuously stash tens of thousands of dollars in cash into his pockets, down his pants or anywhere else an airport security guard was unlikely to find it.  People who transport things illegally are also often called mules, so I'm guessing "donkey boy" was just a twist on that terminology.



Source(s):



https://secure.nypost.com/seven/03232008...



http://cheeyi.wordpress.com/tag/movies/



</answer>

<question>



What was the title of that SF movie where people got sucked into the ground?



I remember a SF movie where people got implants into their necks. This was done by leading them to a specific place (where a UFO was buried into the ground), where they would get sucked into the UFO. A little boy knew what was going on (I think the movie starts with him seeing the UFO landing), and he got some others convinced.



Any idea what movie I'm talking about?



</question>



<additional details>



It's a pretty old movie, probably a TV movie. I first saw it when I was 12 or 13, I think (that would be 22 years ago). So no X-files episode or Invasion of the Body Snatchers (still love the '78 version with Donald Sutherland!)



</additional details>



<answer from>



Princess Leia
Member since: 05 July 2006
Total points: 12762 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Invaders From Mars (1986)



On the night of a comet storm, young David Gardner (Hunter Carson) sees an alien spacecraft land in a sand quarry behind his house. This is the beginning of an alien invasion that sees David's parents George (Timothy Bottoms) and Ellen (Laraine Newman), his teachers and the townspeople slowly assimilated by the alien lifeforms. The only one who believes David is the school nurse (Karen Black). Together, the two enlist the aid of the U.S. Marines to help save the world.



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invaders_fr...



I hope that's it!!!



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Yes! This is the movie I was talking about. Thanks for your thorough answer!



</asker's comment>

<answer>



As of late, "Untraceable" is the best...both very exciting and very intelligent, plus downright scary at points: it has the feel of a good Michael Crichton novel.  Though it is about a hacker and thus having technical gets you a bit deeper into the story, anyone into CSI should have no problem following it.  The most incredible thing is the sense of "you know, this could really happen"...everything they claim to happen in the movie is a technical and/or social engineering possibility.



"Meet the Fockers" is also good; especially funny if you get all the nuances (particularly if you are Jewish or enjoy Yiddish-type humor).

<question from>



Tamonnnn...
Member since: 07 February 2006
Total points: 1287 (Level 3)



</question from>



<question>



What does the user reviews of "An American Carol" say about us?



imdb.com's user ratings for "An American Carol" are very divided.  As of 9:40am Monday morning, 42.4% gave it a 10 (great) and 34.7% gave it a 1 (awful).  That means 77.1% gave it either a 10 or 1.  I've never seen a split like that before.  Here's the link: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1190617/rati...



Is American politics so strong that it determines what movies we like/don't like?  If so, what does this say about us?



</question>



<answer from>



megann C
Member since: 13 June 2007
Total points: 234 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



yeah in a way because if someone is gay in the movie and people don't agree with it they aren't going to get Sales from that person.
but i liked an American carol cause it made fun of those stupid libs.
THANK THE LORD THEY MADE A MOVIE ABOUT THAT!!!!!!



</answer>



<answer from>



Jimmy W
Member since: 01 July 2007
Total points: 4423 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



A very interesting fact. (I've never heard of the movie before, but the fact is interesting.)



Look at it this way: on electon Day, John Smith goes into a booth. He knows exactly who he is going to vote for (10), and by consequence he knows exactly who he won't vote for (1). John knows which side of the fence he sits on, he's not cradling it.



So extraploting this fact, we know that 77.1 of the imdb voters know which political party they support. 22.9 are somewhere in between.



(Also, you could assume that people just didn't like/did like the movie.)



</answer>

<original file>15053.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk64940.txt</current file name>




<category>



Entertainment & Music



Movies



</category>



<question from>



S C
Member since: 31 July 2008
Total points: 54 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How do they do the basketball shooting scenes in movies and stuff?



For e.g. in One Tree Hill, how do they do the scenes where Nathan or someone else shoots the ball and it goes straight through the hoop? Like do the actors actually practice until they're that good, and the directors keep shooting it until the actors get it right, or is it somehow digitally enhanced?



</question>



<answer from>



Trevon A
Member since: 25 November 2007
Total points: 313 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Hello there... I had same question like yours . I  found  best answer by searching at below site.



Source(s):



http://snipurl.com/3oomv



</answer>



<answer from>



Marilyn B
Member since: 09 October 2006
Total points: 45282 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



The actors are usually shown shooting the ball and another shot is of the ball going into the hoop. So with editing, it only appears that the person has made the shot. There are, of course, exceptions in which the camera just keeps rolling until the actor actually makes a basket but time is money. One great basketball shot, however, was made in the movie Alien: Resurrection (1997). Do you remember when Sigourney Weaver thew a basketball backwards and made a basket? Well, that really happened and, fortunately, it was caught on camera and the scene was used in the film.



</answer>

<answer>



UPDATED:  Alright, non-horror movies:  Breakfast Club, American Pie, Superbad, 10 Things I Hate About You, The New Guy, Charlie Bartlett, Disturbia (scary, but pretty true to teenage nature), Sky High, Ferris Bueller's Day Off, Dazed and Confused, Fast Times at Ridgemont High, and Not Another Teen Movie.



</answer>

<question from>



markme13
Member since: 20 May 2007
Total points: 37 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How much does working at an AMC Movie Theater Part Time pay?



These are the job positions.



Concessionist - prepare and serve concession items to our guests, clean the concession area, and assist with other theatre functions



Usher - clean and maintain the auditoriums, restrooms, and lobbies while controlling access to the theatre and the auditoriums



Cashier - sell movie tickets and AMC Entertainment cards and inform guests about currently featured films, policies, programs, and more



Film Crew Lead - train and help the Film Crew and perform theatre functions



Operations Coordinator - help the management team ensure theatre functions run smoothly and efficiently



Booth Crew Member - operate film projectors, sound equipment, and related equipment in the theatre



Facility Assistant - help the Facilities Maintenance Manager inspect the theatre and assist with painting, carpentry, plumbing, and more



Administrative Assistant - provide theatre management with administrative support for accounting, concessions, human resources, scheduling, facility management, and other areas



Well as you can see theres all diffrent positions, but how much does the Usher job pay if anyone knows? I guess like working behind the counter (Serving popcorn and drinks etc. pays the same as usher) but how much? Does anyone know what part time pays there? It doesnt say on the site.



And also ---- How many free movie tickets do you get? and how often do you get them? Do you get free popcorn and screenings too?



Thanks



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



the minimum wage which is 8.20 bucks an hour



</answer>

<answer from>



Kat
Member since: 24 March 2008
Total points: 2892 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



The only thing I liked about it was how well the Joker was played - I know everyone says this but it's true that he was amazingly well done, and he came across as genuinely sinister and twisted.



I disagreed with the film's 12A rating because I thought there were scenes in it that were quite disturbing and I wouldn't have taken someone under 12 to see it.



The actual storyline was a bit boring, and I kept forgetting that the film was actually supposed to be about Batman, as well as the fact that it went on for way too long, they could have cut it down a bit because it got really boring towards the end.



Out of 10 I'd give it 6.



</answer>



<answer from>



Raely M
Member since: 12 March 2008
Total points: 506 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



1. personally I loved it. I thought that the action was good and well done while the dialog was done well as well. It had some great base ideas that expanded really well. I enjoyed all of it, the joker included.  I thought the scoring was done well and the script was well thought through.



2. disagree- the first hour was history, it has to be done and it was well done.



3. disagree-The movie was done nicely, heath ledger died doesnt mean that the movie was in anyway better, it may have been seen more because it was his last full movie but non the less, the movie was very good.
4.disagree, i was never bored in the movie. I usually get bored in movies and often look at my watch to see if it is almost over but there was rarely a moment i even wanted to look away from the screen.



5. agree- the dialog was great, it had so many different catches to it and I loved it. The joker was insane enough not be over the top and the special effects were done nicely. I say Well done!



</answer>

Coma+

<question from>



markwill...

Movies



</question from>



<question>



Is "Mutiny" ever been released on DVD (read details)?



1944 (i think) Port Chicago:



Black sailors are treated terrible, and are doing the most dangerous work at this ammunition loading port. They are nearly slaves to their white officers and are living in the worst conditions.



A large explosion rips through the port destoying a ammo ship, another ship and a large portion of the dock area.



When work resumes, 50 black sailors refuse to return to work and are charged with mutiny. They are all sentenced to long term prison terms.



(side note) only 3 lived to see Bill Clinton give them all a pardon.



sad story.



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



This was a made for TV movie (1999)  and yes it is available on DVD, as well as VHS.
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0181769/
It can be purchased here: http://www.amazon.com/s/?url=search-alia...



Here is a an article from the New York Times that you may find interesting.



Sailor From Mutiny in '44 Wins a Presidential Pardon



(dated Dec. 24, 1999)
http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.ht...



</answer>

<original file>2507.html</original file>

<category>



Entertainment & Music



Movies



</category>



<question from>



lovethed...
Member since: 24 August 2008
Total points: 420 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Quiz from Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban... easy 10 points for any fan...?



Here are 10 trivia questions from Harry potter and the prisoner of azkaban, number three.



If you've got any feedback, i would love it.



They are listed randomly, not from easier to harder.



Good luck!



1 What does the Boggart turn into when Proffesor Lupin takes it on? Why?



2 What is the phrase used to wipe the Marauders' map of its infroamtion, so others can't read it?



3 Who are the four wizards responsible for creating the Marauder's map?



4 Why does Gryffindor lose it's Quidditch match against Slytherin? What is the weather like at the time?



5 How many Christmas trees are in the Great hall during Christmas?



6 Who is the driver of the Knight Bus, which picks Harry up when he's stranded?



7 What breaks Harry's Nimbus Two Thousand broomstick?



8 What device helps Hermione to attend so many classes?



9 Who is in the picture that replaces the Fat Lady when Sirius Black breaks into Gryffindor tower?



10 What is the spell used to repell Dementors? What form does Harry's take?



Thanks, hope you enjoyed it! :)



</question>



<answer from>



Sassi
Member since: 21 July 2008
Total points: 757 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



1) A moon, because Lupin is a werewolf, and so fears a full moon.



2)Mischeif managed.



3) Wormtail (Peter pettigrew) Moony (Remus Lupin) Padfoot (Sirius Lupin) Prongs (James Potter)



4) Because the dementors come, and harry faints and falls. Rainy.



5) 12



6) Ernie.



7) The whomping willow.



8) The timerturner necklace thing :)

<question>



What is this movie I'm thinking of?



I'm thinking of this movie I saw some years ago... it wasn't very popular but it had Matthew McConahay (sp?) in it and he gets the "voice of God." He has to kill some people in it and he gets his family involved.



If anyone knows the name of this movie, could you also provide a summary?



</question>



<answer from>



Nora T
Member since: 06 October 2008
Total points: 115 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



That's probably "Frailty".



IMBD.com gives this summary: "Fenton Meeks (Matthew McConaughey), comes forth to tell the FBI that his brother Adam may be the serial killer who calls himself God's Hands, who the FBI has been searching for. The film uses flashbacks to show Meeks' childhood with a father (Bill Paxton) who believed he was on a mission from God to destroy demons that inhabit human bodies. Fenton saw his dad as evil, while Adam saw him as a hero."



</answer>



<asker's comment>



You are right... thanks!



</asker's comment>



<answer from>

rebornph...

</answer>



<answer from>



Mary C
Member since: 13 April 2008
Total points: 4284 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



Because revivals are not taken into consideration when compiling gross receipts only first run movies are.  RHPS revivals are playing on Friday and Saturday nights at midnight with live stage shows here in Vegas in two theaters.



</answer>



<answer from>



gothicma...
Member since: 16 August 2007
Total points: 4326 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>

</answer>

<category>



Entertainment & Music



Movies



</category>



<question from>



Alan B
Member since: 17 June 2006
Total points: 127 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



I want to pay a video film with ?



I want to play a video dvd with subtitles but my tv screen will not show all the video picture so subtitles are not all visible. How can I either adjust the tv screen or the dvd to ensure all the picture is visible on my tv?



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



Your tv needs an update. if this is the case, usually there is a zoom out option on your remote control, it will make the image a bit smaller but you'll definitely get some subs.



if your tv doesn't need an update. Check you screen settings. there might be something off set.you can easily check by putting your tv  setting back to default.



None of this is working? go to basics and check your cables.



</answer>

The All Saints became one of the most successful British pop group of the 1990s with five #1 hits in the UK and two multi-platinum albums. Their second single, "Never Ever", is their biggest hit, topping the charts in UK and Australia.

<question>



Is the movie Idiocracy proving more and more prophetic and accurate?



I mean, at first, I just found Idiocracy funny, but now it's starting to become scarily accurate. It ranks up there with 1984 and Fahrenheit 451.



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



Are we all going to be idiots dependent on TV? I don't think so. Sure TV (and internet) can be a big part of our lives nowadays, but I don't think we'll allow ourselves to sink to Idiocracy levels. It's just not in our nature ... something we'll realize sooner or later.



</answer>

Lead character is a serial cheater and at one point juggles 3 girlfriends simultaneously. Very funny and clever movie. It is a teen flick though.



</answer>

<question from>



pawan00
Member since: 15 March 2008
Total points: 110 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Is The Movie Prom Night Suitable for 13 year old kids?



I don't really care if theres swearing or language but...has it got rude scenes?



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



Nothing sexually graphic, but it is focusing on 3 couples who are quite in love so you have a few scenes where there is kissing and implications to sex but no nudity or anything like that. If you're thinking in terms of a Halloween movie for some younger teens then I support that thought. It's very well written for both adults and the scares that teens want.



I think it's suitable and enjoyable. Have fun :)



Here is IMDb's parent review for a more detailed approach:
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0926129/pare...



</answer>

<answer from>



Tyler Read
Member since: 21 September 2008
Total points: 417 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Have you read the book? The movie seems interesting but afar from the original book. The only thing that would hold me back from going to see it is Michael Cera. As Nick, Cera plays an appealing version of himself just as he did in "Juno," "Superbad" and "Arrested Development." Apparently it remains a good thing, and he should keep on doing it, so I'll still see it. But as I recall, the Nick I read about was hardly a fragile man-child Cera always plays. That being said, I don't think many other young actors could pull off a good Nick though, so it goes unnoticed.



Everything else looks fantastic from the trailers to the advertising to the draw on so many different levels to people of all ages. I'm excited to see it and glad to see that a young adult book was published into film.



</answer>

<question>



I hv all the players tht wer there in tht link....but still i'm unable 2 play the .002 file......?



</question>



<answer from>



gofyours...
Member since: 22 September 2008
Total points: 250 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



*Reads your question*



*head asplodes*



</answer>



<answer from>



SunGlyde...
Member since: 17 August 2008
Total points: 489 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Ummmmmmmmmmmmmmm



Try downloading the .002 file again?



Is that what you mean?



</answer>



<answer from>



mattias carlsson
Member since: 10 January 2006
Total points: 4447 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



Files that are named .001 .002 etc are fragments of a complete file. So you have to put them together again, usually using the same type of program that was used to split them up.



Try HJoin or similar.



</answer>

<category>



Entertainment & Music

<question from>



Ann
Member since: 14 September 2008
Total points: 96 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Can I play movies on CD-Roms?



If I'm downloading a movie off the internet and I want to save it to a CD-Rom, will the movie play when I put the CD-Rom into my dvd player and watch the movie on my tv?



</question>



<answer from>



YOU'RE ALL STUPID
Member since: 30 October 2008
Total points: 129 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOLLLLLL...



No it wont even burn



</answer>



<answer from>



lotusloo...
Member since: 28 August 2008
Total points: 485 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



depends on the file  extension.. and the tools
do u have a correct tools to burn



</answer>



<answer from>



Oabali
Member since: 26 June 2008
Total points: 273 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



convert your video into VCD, which are basically used with conventional CD-Rs. These can play on most DVD players (just check specs). Nero can help you.



</answer>



<answer from>



Froggie
Member since: 02 June 2006
Total points: 14811 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



No only CD/DVD-R and make sure that you buy over 4 for quality, kodak seem to be the best and you can find them in your supermarket, hope this helps, goodluck! :)

<original file>5281.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk80469.txt</current file name>




<category>



Entertainment & Music



Movies



</category>



<question from>



jenni72x
Member since: 01 October 2007
Total points: 185 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What is the movie's name about a man who deep sea dives without equipment?



It's an older movie.  I believe that in the end he lets go of the rope and swims off with a dolphin.



</question>



<answer from>



fxrfxd
Member since: 02 July 2008
Total points: 1372 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Sounds like The Big Blue.



Two men answer the call of the ocean in this romantic fantasy adventure. Jacques (Jean-Marc Barr) and Enzo (Jean Reno) are a pair of friends who have been close since childhood, and who share a passion for the dangerous sport of free diving. Professional diver Jacques opted to follow in the footsteps of his father, who died at sea when Jacques was a boy; to the bewilderment of scientists, Jacques harbors a remarkable ability to adjust his heart rate and breathing pattern in the water, so that his vital signs more closely resemble that of dolphins than men (he even considers a school of dolphins as his extended family). As Enzo persuades a reluctant Jacques to compete against him in a free diving contest - determining who can dive deeper and longer without scuba gear - Jacques meets Johanna (Rosanna Arquette), a beautiful insurance investigator from America, and he finds that he must choose between his love for her and his love of the sea. Le Grand Bleu ran 132 minutes in its original French version, but it was trimmed to 118 for American release, with the original score by Eric Serra replaced by music from Bill Conti. While the film did middling business in the U.S., it was a huge success in Europe, and director Luc Besson released an expanded 168 minute version in 1998.



Source(s):



IMDb



</answer>

<answer>



Rick Jones!

By the way, I bought my first Marvel comics at the age of 10, just as "Fantastic Four" debuted in 1961 and became a devoted fan of their other titles. Out of all of those characters, I pick Rick~~AND Johnny Storm. (Who was insane enough to cast Chris Evans?! Then, there's Jessica Alba...)



Here's information about Rick Jones, but... YUCK! That Wikipicture is so bulked-up that it bears little resemblance to him. They have the bad habit of doing that to every character, which is an unfortunate move that takes away individuality.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rick_Jones_...

Looking for some good bollywood films?



Starting a collection

</answer from>



<answer>

</question from>



<question>



Sequel &gt; Trilogy &gt; Quadrilogy &gt; ??? &gt; Anthology &gt; Etc..?



A set of books or films in a set of 3 for example, is called a Trilogy, as most of us know and a set of 2 would be a sequel etc. etc. etc. BUT, what do you call a set of 5, 7, 8, 9 or more???



</question>



<answer from>



MystMoon...
Member since: 09 September 2007
Total points: 75901 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



2: duology
3: trilogy
4: tetralogy or quadrilogy
5: pentalogy
6: hexology
7: heptalogy or septology or septet



From Wikipedia:



duology (2)



trilogy (3)



pentalogy (5)



hexology (6)



heptalogy (7)



octology (8)



ennealogy (9)



decology (10)



Source(s):



http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/tetralogy



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Exactly What I Needed to Know!



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Jim T
Member since: 25 October 2006
Total points: 8693 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



Others have given names for each.  I just want to say that many film makers and writers just call anything over 3 a series or trilogy.  A good example was Douglas Adams who insisted in calling the 4 Hitchhikers Guides a trilogy.



</answer>



<answer from>



Richard D
Member since: 05 December 2007
Total points: 5659 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Greed. An attempt to milk a franchise for every possible penny. Few that go past part 2 are worth it.



</answer>



<answer from>



Nany
Member since: 14 September 2007
Total points: 180 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



A saga.



</answer>



<answer from>



Jeffy.
Member since: 20 March 2008
Total points: 13663 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



A series.



</answer>

<answer from>



terrified by spiders
Member since: 17 May 2006
Total points: 5045 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Bagpipe music, either you like it or you don't. I've been told that it's a difficult instrument to learn, but if you want to attempt it, you start with a longish hollow rod (looks something like a flute) and you don't have to worry about the bag part just yet.



I love it, have CDs of bagpipe music. Bagpipes are played at funerals, and also at weddings, and if you are in London, go down to Euston station, and there will be the cutest busker (well, he used to be cute, but he's geting older now) playing his bagpipe for tips.



Amazing Grace may have been Scottish all along, maybe it's we anglos who have adapted it.



</answer>

<answer>



In comparison to the ones you requested, I would say no. Cape Fear is more of a thriller than a horror movie. The Blair Witch Project was amusing enough to me on the first view. The Exorcist was an achievement for it's time and freaked out many people, but it wasn't that frightening to me at 16. I am guessing you are a teenager. I think The Shining or It would give you many memories that you wouldn't forget and would still be age appropriate for teens 16 and up.

<answer>



Ok "I Love Hernias", you wanna be scared? Check out these films: "Frontiér(s)" - France/2008 - widely regarded as the most horrific film ever made; "High Tension" - also France (2005) - its dubbed and probably just as shocking as Frontiér(s). This film is also called "Switchblade Romance"; Rob Zombie's 2007 remake of "Halloween"; "The STrangers" (2008); "The Messengers" (2007); "Vacancy" (2007); "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre" (2003) and "Wolf Creek" (2005) - this is an Australian horror that has to be seen to be believed. These films are what I would classify as "scary" - "Cape Fear" is a good thriller, but its not scary and "blair Witch Project"? You gotta be kiding me. But its up to you - the film's I've just mentioned, particularil "Frontiér(s)", are absolutely barbaric, horrific and gut-wrenchingly terrifying - if you want your mum to s hit her pants and you, then check them out.....at night....with the doors locked.



Hope I helped! Below is a link to the YT Trailer of "Frontiér(s)"! Check it out!



BlueSpirit :::

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GmmpJSiqU...



</answer>

<original file>14679.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk88504.txt</current file name>




<category>



Entertainment & Music



Movies



</category>



<question from>



Jagex Support
Member since: 26 September 2007
Total points: 174 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What happens to han solo in star wars?



what happens to han solo in star wars



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



Very broad question as you've not asked of a specific time period, however I will attempt to give you a time line.



1. Is born on Corellia
2. Is a smuggler with a small pirate outfit (raised by an older female Wookie)
3. Joins the Imperial Academy
4. Gets discharged from Imperial service due to opposition to treating Wookies as slaves. Rescues or saves Chewbacca.
5. Wins Millenium Falcon from Lando Calrissian in sabacc game.
6. Has some stories prior to Episode 4.
7. Dumps load of spice (owned by Jabba the Hutt).
8. Picks up Luke Skywalker & Obi-Wan Kenobi on Tattoine.
9. Helps Luke rescue Leia from Death Star.
10. Saves Luke during attack on Death Star.
11. Saves Luke again on Hoth.
12. Saves Leia from being captured on Hoth.
13. Flies through asteroid field (tricking Imperial Navy).
14. Gets followed by Boba Fett to Bespin.
15. Is frozen in carbonite by Darth Vader and transported to Jabba the Hutt by Boba Fett.
16. Gets released from carbonite by Leia in bounty hunter disguise.
17. Saves Lando Calrissian from Sarlacc.
18. Knocks Boba Fett into Sarlacc.
19. Accompanies Luke to Endor.
20. Blows up shield generator on Endor.
21. Marries Leia.
22. Has twins with Leia (Jaina and Jacen).
23. Has 3rd child with Leia (Anakin).
24. Loses Chewbacca during fight with Yuzhon Vong.
25. Loses Anakin during this war but later.
26. Loses sister-in-law Mara Jade Skywalker to his son (Jacen).
27. Loses Jacen to the dark side of the Force.
28. Loses Jacen when Jaina must kill Jacen.



Source(s):



Me - Star Wars Fan.



</answer>

<answer>



Don't know, but if you can find it, watch The Godfather Saga.  It's a different version, wherein The Godfather and Godfather II are combined and re-edited to place all of the events in chronological sequence, without flashbacks.  If you're familiar with both movies, you'll find it a very interesting alternative.  I've been watching it, frame by frame, for years, as Robert DeNiro stalks the "don" from rooftop to rooftop as the crowd parties in the street, as I try to spot my father and uncle, who were among the hundreds of "extras" in the scene.  No luck yet, but wihen I get a high-def TV and blu-ray dvd, I may have a better chance.



</answer>

<original file>2058.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk90611.txt</current file name>




<category>



Entertainment & Music



Movies



</category>



<question from>



Shane
Member since: 11 January 2008
Total points: 122 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Screenplay Copyright/Rights Question?



I'm in the middle of writing a screenplay about an actual man, who died about forty years ago. It will depict his middle-aged life, and also the large company/brand in which he worked for/was affiliated with.



With depicting this man's life, and also the company he worked for, what kind of copyright/permission would I need to obtain before trying to sell this, if any? Like, would I need persmission from his family, or from the company I'd be depicting or what?



Thanks



</question>



<answer from>



Jonathan T
Member since: 30 October 2008
Total points: 100 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



I would be sure to get a written agreement with the family before persuing the selling of the project.  It also would be wise of you to set up a meeting time with the company to talk, or even let them read the screenplay, so that they are aware that the film does not portray the company in a bad light.



Be sure to get signatures saying that they do not oppose the selling of this screenplay.  Not only will that save you any legal trouble down the line, but it will keep agents and producers from reluctantly turning down your script because of the possible legal trouble.



I do not believe you will need to get a certain copyright (unless someone else owns the movie rights to this man's life story).  Just approval should be fine.



</answer>



<answer from>



B-Jo
Member since: 15 February 2008
Total points: 3842 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



I am a writer myself and I would like to advise the following things to you.



1) You can write this but if this story is inspired by someone you know then you should let them know that you are thinking about writing a story of the events that has/is happening in that persons life. You can change the character names.



2) Once you write it, it's yours. It is your written work and no one can do anything to take that away from you.



3) You don't have to get it published if you don't want too. There are a number of things you can do with it once you've finished.



</answer>






<original file>2059.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk90612.txt</current file name>




<category>



Entertainment & Music



Movies



</category>



<question from>



Eternal Thought
Member since: 17 May 2008
Total points: 446 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



What does "Quantum of Solace" mean?



It sounds cool, but what is it? I know the meaning of separate words, but together?



</question>



<answer from>



B-Jo
Member since: 15 February 2008
Total points: 3842 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



Since the title of the 22nd Bond Film was disclosed on January 24, Bond fans across the world have struggled to understand what it means and how it will play into the film. According to producer Michael G. Wilson, a quantum of solace is essentially a measure of comfort. “I think it’s very appropriate for this film because based on what happened to the character of James Bond in the last film, Casino Royale, he needs a quantum of solace, considering his mental state,” said Wilson.



When we last saw 007, he had shut himself off emotionally following the betrayal of his first true love, Vesper Lynd. His last words about here were “the ***** is dead,” which is not something someone who has come to terms with Vesper’s death would say. All of the interviews and articles on Quantum of Solace reveal the same point: that the film will be far darker than Casino Royale and will involve much soul searching on Bond’s part



Michael G. Wilson was also quoted as saying: "You know, Quantum of Solace is a short story from Ian Fleming. I think it works for the film; I think it works for the story. In a sense, I think it was a good move to use an original title from Ian Fleming." Below is an excerpt from the short story Quantum of Solace from Ian Fleming's For Your Eyes Only.



Source(s):



http://www.universalexports.net/Movies/q...



</answer>



<answer from>



SEAN J
Member since: 28 May 2008
Total points: 15142 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



Title of a book by Fleming - i think it was a short story.



</answer>

<question from>



graham b

</question from>



<question>

<question>



When is harry potter and the half blood prince out in cinema and DVD?



oh come on. please...



</question>



<answer from>



emma b
Member since: 27 October 2008
Total points: 194 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



It's out in the cinema in July 2009.  The original release date was November this year however it was pushed back.



There was an official reason given but the real reason is that due to the writers strike there's gonna be a 6 month period where there's gonna be a gap in the market for real blockbusters.  This gap is gonna be next summer so surprise surprise, they moved the movie so that they could be the only blockbuster for the summer therefore making lots of money rather than competing with the other Christmas movies.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



at long last, you got long long stories. now i will give you 10 points for the prize. prize:10 points.



</asker's comment>

<original file>411.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk92891.txt</current file name>




<category>



Entertainment & Music



Movies



</category>



<question from>



ultralig...
Member since: 03 March 2008
Total points: 600 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Can you name this Movie 80's I think?



Boy survives cliff car accident where is parents and maybe sister preish in what I recall being colorado (could be way off here.  He happens around and meets a cancer stricken fellow who teaches him how to survive.  I would say I saw this film perhaps 20 years ago perhaps longer.



Can you name it?  I would love to watch it again.  Take care,



</question>



<answer from>



MystMoon...
Member since: 09 September 2007
Total points: 75901 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



The Earthling (1980)
IMDb synopsis:
Patrick Foley (William Holden) has been on the move all his life. Tired of drifting, he wants to spend his last days in an isolated Australian valley where he grew up. On his difficult journey, he meets Shawn (Ricky Schroder), a desperate little city-boy whose parents were killed in an accident in this remote, inhospitable territory. Being unable to accompany the boy back to the civilized world, Foley reluctantly takes him with him on his trip to that valley and teaches him in a rugged way how to survive.



Here's one site where copies are available:
http://www.amazon.com/s/?url=search-alia...



The accident occurs when his parents are in the motorhome, which ends up backing off of a high bluff. The boy witnesses this and obviously is in a state of shock and is quite helpless. Holden's character does not want to take care of the boy, but his conscience won't let him simply leave him to survive on his own, even if he himself is dying. Yes, I think this is your film, and it's a remarkable one, with amazing performances from William Holden, who would appear in only one more film; and Ricky Schroder, who had been in only two other movies~"The Champ" (his debut) and "The Last Flight of Noah's Ark".



Source(s):



http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0080671/



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thats the one.  How you found it I have no idea.  Thank you very much!



</asker's comment>






<original file>412.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk92902.txt</current file name>




<category>



Entertainment & Music



Movies



</category>



<question from>



European Women rocks
Member since: 30 March 2008
Total points: 2118 (Level 3)



</question from>



<question>



Dark Knight and Iron Man Question?



Tony Stark in Iron man is very happy, he smiles, laughs and likes women alot. He's a happy man.But Bruce Wayne seems to have a darker personality, he barely smiles, he doesn't hang out with women and he doesn't look like someone that is happy. Anyone see the difference there? i just realized it. What's your take?



</question>



<answer from>



T.S.R.  (Pro-humanity)
Member since: 15 August 2008
Total points: 9579 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Rock and Pop



Other - Music



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



That's because they are two different characters.



Tony Stark--the happy-go lucky, brilliant playboy, who plays on the side of the law, as seen in Civil War.



Bruce Wayne--the brooding, brilliant pretend playboy, who has no patience for people like Stark.  And who takes the law into his own hands.  It probably doesn't help that Wayne has had a much more tragic life than Stark, even though they are both financially fortunate.



If every superhero had the same personality, the comics would cease to be original and interesting.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



true



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



The Mouse II
Member since: 21 December 2007
Total points: 29693 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Movies



Yahoo! Answers



</answer from>



<answer>



Yes, but... what's your point? "Anyone see the difference there?" I mean... are they supposed to be similar or something?



They are two different people from two different lives and experience  doing two different things.
And they are NOT from the same comic franchise.



Still not sure why you are asking this?
It's like saying... Carrots are red and potatoes are white - can anyone see the difference here?



</answer>

This small video WILL REALLY HELP YOU!

<answer from>



Banana Ray David
Member since: 14 December 2006
Total points: 3337 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



3D movies were a big fad for a year or two in the 1950s, when Hollywood had to compete with the rise of television. But in the long run, it was impractical, mainly because making everyone sit through 90 minutes wearing funny goggles was a strain on the eyes. By the mid-'50s it had died out. There's only been occasional 3D movies since then (Jaws 3 is the only big one I can think of since then).



Source(s):



There's an interesting short documentary about the 3D fad on the R2 version of Hitchcock's Dial M for Murder (1953), which was filmed in 3D.



</answer>



<answer from>



7Things I Love About Miley Cyrus
Member since: 27 May 2006
Total points: 1484 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>

<question>



Help with a movie!!!!?



I saw this movie ages ago but cant remember wat its called it has this skeleton who goes into a christmas town the skeletons town is halloween town



</question>



<answer from>



MystMoon...
Member since: 09 September 2007
Total points: 76135 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993)
a Tim Burton film
Wikipedia synopsis:
"Halloween Town" is a dream world filled with citizens such as deformed monsters, ghosts, ghouls, goblins, vampires, werewolves, and witches. Jack Skellington, "The Pumpkin King", is their monarch and grows tired of the repetitive yearly celebration of Halloween. He wanders in the woods, where he accidentally opens a portal to "Christmas Town". Impressed by the feeling and style of Christmas, Jack presents the culture to the citizens of Halloween Town of his slightly inaccurate impressions. While Jack may slightly understand Christmas, the townspeople fail to do so and compare everything Jack says to their ideas of Halloween. Nonetheless the townspeople agree to celebrate Christmas and take over the holiday. Jack's obsession with Christmas leads him to usurp the role of Santa Claus. Every resident is assigned a task, while Sally, a rag doll-type resident, begins a romantic attraction towards Jack. However, she alone fears that his plans will become disastrous. Jack then assigns Lock, Shock, and Barrel, a trio of mischievous children to abduct Santa and take him to Halloween Town.



Here are a couple of segments from YouTube:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bz2Ho62dV...
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QY2tJRh5V...



As you can see by the following posters, this definitely is your movie! It's appropriate for Halloween AND Christmas!



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Nightma...



</answer>

foevryur...

<question>



Traditional Bollywood films?



Does anyone really miss the really lovey dovey bollywood films set in india like dilwale duhania le jayenge, kuch kuch hota hai and films like that. Its a shame the film makers feel they need to westernise their films and copy hollywood. i really miss films from the 90's. Does anyone else??



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



I used to love watching the old Bollywood films on a saturday afternoon. My favourite has to be 'Vaada". Can't say that I have enjoyed any of the Bollywood films of the last few years. Take the 'Mistress of Spice' which the story itself is about traditional meeting the westernised world. It just lacked any of the true Bollywood magic.



</answer>

<question>



Donnie Darko...whats the fat man all about?



I am a massive fan of the film Donnie Darko, but I could never understand the plot relevance of the fat man who wears a red jump suit and sunglasses. He is seen twice, once by gretchen when she doesnt want to kiss Donnie in the woods; he justs puts out a ciggarette then walks off, then later at the halloween house party he is hanging around outside with a torch...whats he doing????



</question>



<answer from>



Kyle J
Member since: 29 June 2006
Total points: 111 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Searched this up. Good question by the way. He resembles the writers imagination. That's what comes to the authors mind when he thinks of embarrassment or great disappointment. E.X she refuses to kiss Donnie. BAM. There he is just lurking



Source(s):



Google



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Interesting. Thanks for the research. :-)



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



AlienSun...
Member since: 16 February 2007

Hard to tell really, the film is a portrayal of a schizophrenic which is why its hard to make sense of it or even know what happening half the time obviously because the character has this mental disorder he has emotionally unstable and is detached from reality, hence the weird rabbit and stuff.



</answer>

<question>



If nobody buys a ticket to a movie do they still show it?



random questions anno i'm quite bored



</question>



<answer from>



Nathan M
Member since: 21 October 2008
Total points: 543 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



I ditched school one day and went and saw The Matrix when it came out.  I was the only one in the theater.



Thats not really an answer, but ask yourself



If a tree falls in the woods does it make a sound?  hmm?



</answer>



<asker's comment>



you made me laugh :-D



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Chase
Member since: 21 July 2008
Total points: 3559 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



I would almost guess that it might vary from theater to theater.  I happen to know for a fact  (as I have a friend that works at the theater) that here in my local Theater in Tennessee, that if nobody buys a ticket, they do NOT show the movie.  I would assume this would be the rule and not the exception, but I'd be surprised if there were theaters that didn't go ahead and show it.



</answer>



<answer from>



Melrose
Member since: 11 March 2006
Total points: 456 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



When I worked @ the local theatre, the answer was no because the projectors have very expensive bulbs and in order to save on the lifetime of the bulb, it wasn't cost effective to run the projector while no one was there to watch said movie.



</answer>



<answer from>



Chris
Member since: 08 July 2008
Total points: 420 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Why would they show a movie if no one is there to watch it. Its a waste of their time and money to show a movie for no one.



Source(s):



my brain



</answer>

<question from>

<question>



How to play a movie downloaded in u torrent?



</question>



<answer from>



makrone
Member since: 28 October 2008
Total points: 212 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Try VLC media player, it plays more or less everything, and it's free.
http://www.videolan.org/vlc/



</answer>



<answer from>



Shariya Lynn
Member since: 09 January 2008
Total points: 158 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



try VLC its pretty standard.
Windows:
www.videolan.org/vlc/download-windows....
Mac:
http://www.videolan.org/vlc/download-mac...



</answer>



<answer from>



James M
Member since: 30 October 2008
Total points: 139 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



So you write click and then select open containing folder.



You may need to unzip the file, if so download the trial of WinZip here:
http://www.winzip.com/downwz.htm



After unzipped, or if you can open the file but it wont play or only audio is played then download this codec pack at:
http://www.free-codecs.com/download/Code...



Install that then restart your computer and the file should play!



Good luck!



</answer>

<question from>



peachfac...

</question from>



<question>



Just seen Donnie Darko..?



I know this must sound really stupid but i honestly didnt get it, i got parts of it just not all of it..
care to explain??
:D



</question>



<answer from>



Robin M
Member since: 03 September 2008
Total points: 271 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



It's very complicated, you can find more extensive explanations online but briefly... (and only as much as I actually understand



- It's all to do with time/time travel



- Imagine time as a straight line, going along as if someone were drawing it with a pencil.



- A few weeks in the future, Donnie Darko's mom and sister are in that plane coming from the sparkle motion audition thing. Their plane engine falls off. When it falls off, it doesn't just fall to the ground. By some weird chance, it falls into this "worm-hole" and gets sucked back in time to when the movie starts.



- First understand that somewhere in the beginning of the movie, theres a plane at an airport which hasn't taken off yet because his mom and sister aren't having the audition yet. When the engine gets sent back in time, there are suddenly two IDENTICAL pieces of matter. They cannot coexist, and the universe will collapse.



- Remember the bunny? He was sent to save the universe from collapsing. He lures Donnie out of bed, and Donnie isn't killed by the engine. He is supposed to guide Donnie through the 28 days until the world collapses. Through many different things involving all the movie's subplots with Patrick Swayze leading to the mom taking the kids to the sparkle motion thing because the other lady had to stay home etc etc... AND HERE'S WHERE I GET CONFUSED...



Somehow when the time comes again for the engine to get sucked into the worm hole, everything rights itself. I'm not sure why.



Something like... When time starts again and Donnie dies when the engine hits him and kills him, his mom never gets on the plane or something...



But I don't understand because there are still two engines in one world.



Thats the best I can do :)



</answer>



<asker's comment>

i pretty much get most of it now :D



</asker's comment>
